Comments_List: I improved my Arabic knowledge from ARBC 110 / L1. I learned some conversational tools, and acquired a lot of new vocabulary. I became more confident in my Arabic abilities.
My Arabic speaking skills improved, as my vocabulary simultaneously expanded.  I also learned more about Arab culture in its many varieties.
Learnt a whole bunch more grammar than in L1! naturally!
Better speaking ability, increased vocabulary, and improved ability to make complete sentences in Modern Standard Arabic

I liked this course a lot with Prof. Sarab. She kept the class very engaging with interactive activities, invited students from the Arab Students Association to converse with us, and continually contextualized whatever we had learnt with appropriate pieces of news and pop-culture. She really cares a lot about the class, I am very glad I took it with her.
I wish there was more Shaami and speaking practice than writing. Also I wish tutoring counted for my Arabic tables

I really love how low stress the course felt for me just because so much of the work was in evenly divided amounts all across the term - as long as you put in work throughout you were gonna be fine, nothing would make or break your grade. Learning with sarab was always fun and felt effective too.

Strengths - more speaking this year than in the past, good constant feedback and opportunities for extra help / improvement
Weaknesses- dont feel like I have a good sense of any dialect

Highly, highly recommend! I wouldn't have expected Arabic to be such a popular choice amongst all kinds of students, regardless of their background. I really liked my classmates and it was a very comfortable environment. I learned a lot, and looked forward to class.
Yes, if you want to learn Arabic, this is the way to do it!  I had a wonderful experience with Professor Sarab.
yes. the overall schedule of the semester was very natural and helpful. A great foundational year
I would but it is a lot of busy work so watch out
Yes definitely! take it with sarab
Yes, if you are committed & plan to continue with Arabic in the long-run!
